text: Here we introduce SNAD ( Sequence Name Annotation - based Designer ) that mediates automatic conversion of sequence UIDs ( associated with multiple alignment or phylogenetic tree , or supplied as plain text list ) into biologically meaningful names and acronyms . This conversion is directed by precompiled or user - defined templates that exploit wealth of annotation available in cognate entries of external databases . Using examples , we demonstrate how this tool can be used to generate names for practical purposes , particularly in virology .
